intro: Linum aureum, commonly known as golden flax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are borne in clusters and have five petals, with the inner ones being larger and more showy. Linum aureum is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
